raw akas.title: Haikyuu!! Tihon Karasuno Neged Academiyat Shiratorizawa
Haikyû!! Karasuno kôkô V Shiratorizawa gakuen kôkô
Haikyuu!! Karasuno Koukou vs. Shiratorizawa Gakuen Koukou

akas: Haikyuu!! Tihon Karasuno Neged Academiyat Shiratorizawa Israel (Hebrew title) (third season title)
Haikyû!! Karasuno kôkô V Shiratorizawa gakuen kôkô Japan (third season title)
Haikyuu!! Karasuno Koukou vs. Shiratorizawa Gakuen Koukou World-wide (English title) (third season title)
akas from release info: Haikyuu!! Tihon Karasuno Neged Academiyat Shiratorizawa Israel (Hebrew title) (third season title)
Haikyû!! Karasuno kôkô V Shiratorizawa gakuen kôkô Japan (third season title)
Haikyuu!! Karasuno Koukou vs. Shiratorizawa Gakuen Koukou World-wide (English title) (third season title)

1.title: Greetings
1.plot: Karasuno is facing Shiratorizawa in the Miyagi Prefecture Qualifier finals of the Spring High School Volleyball Tournament. Is Karasuno strong enough to beat Shiratorizawa and their #1 ace spiker Ushijima? This is the start.

2.title: The Threat of 'Left'
2.plot: Nishinoya is having problems with Ushijima's left-handed spikes. How will the Guardian Deity of Karasuno overcome with this hurdle? .

3.title: GUESS-MONSTER
3.plot: Hinata and Kageyama may have declared war on Ushijima, but, using his own style of blocking, Shiratorizawa's Tendo poses a more direct threat to the duo.

4.title: The Halo Around the Moon
4.plot: The last part of the 2nd set. Karasuno comes back at Shiratorizawa with Tsukishima and Nishinoya's total defense. They end up in a heated battle in the end, resulting in multiple deuces... Who will score the final point?

5.title: Individual VS Numbers
5.plot: Karasuno continues to adapt to fight against Shiratorizawa's overpowering strength. Meanwhile, Hinata must evolve his blocks if he wants to change the momentum of the game.

6.title: The Chemical Change of Encounters
6.plot: Remembering where they started from, the third years are determined to give this fight their all and make it to nationals. Meanwhile, the stamina of 4 sets is beginning to wear on Kageyama.

7.title: Obsession
7.plot: Karasuno is entering their first 5-set game. Will they have the stamina to endure the last set? It's Strength vs. Combinations!

8.title: An Annoying Guy
8.plot: Tsukishima is still out of the game with his hand injured. Narita subs in and Hinata continues to work on blocking. Sugawara squares off against Tendo's guess blocking.

9.title: The Volleyball Idiots
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: The Battle of Concepts
10.plot: Karasuno, who were once named as the "Fallen Rivals" and "Flightless Crows", defeats Shiratorizawa with a score of 21-19. Tears of joy and mixed emotions burst through, as Karasuno resolves to win the upcoming Spring Interhigh Tournament.

1.title: The End & the Beginning
1.plot: Hinata has been intrigued by volleyball ever since seeing the Small Giant playing. After struggling to find a team, he finally get's to go to a tournament three years later for the first time. There they play against Kitagawa Daiichi, a powerhouse middle school, and Kageyama Tobio who is infamously known as the King of the Court. Their match sparks a interesting rivalry between the two. However, a year later, when Hinata joins a high school volleyball team, he finds a new unexpected team mate there.

2.title: Karasuno High School Volleyball Club
2.plot: After just joining the Karasuno Volleyball team, Hinata is faced with a new obstacle. His middle school rival, Kageyama, is also a potential member of the team. When the disapproving captain arrives, he quickly kicks them out until they can get along.

3.title: The Formidable Ally
3.plot: With sophomore Tanaka on their side, Hinata and Kageyama are up against freshmen Tsukishima and Yamaguchi and third-year team-captain Sawamura in a three-on-three match.

4.title: The View from the Summit
4.plot: Kageyama and Hinata both win their places on the team. But when the team's new coach, Ittetsu Takeda arrives, his announcement of a practice match with one of the top volleyball teams in the prefecture has both of them scrambling.

5.title: A Coward's Anxiety
5.plot: After the 3 vs 3, the first years are welcomed into the club as full members just in time for a practice match with Aoba Johsai. Will Hinata be able to handle the pressure of his first real match?

6.title: An Interesting Team
6.plot: Hinata and Kageyama are in full form, and it looks like victory is inevitable. But when Seijoh's captain Oikawa returns to the court, will Karasuno be able to fend off his super serves?

7.title: Versus the Great King
7.plot: Sophomore Nishinoya, the "Guardian God" of Karasuno Volleyball Club, returns to rally the other club-members during practice. Meanwhile, Takeda is still pulling for Keishin Ukai to be the next coach of Karasuno High-and he has a plan that just might work.

8.title: He Who Is Called "Ace"
8.plot: With the match against Nekoma looming, temp coach Ukai arranges an exhibition against his local volleyball association ... and now Azumane must prove he deserves his title.

9.title: A Toss to the Ace
9.plot: It's time for the Karasu versus Neighborhood Association team practice-match, where Asahi lives up to his title. With Hinata in pure awe of Asahi's gameplay, Kageyama makes moves to get Hinata back on track.

10.title: Yearning
10.plot: Gearing up for their match against Nekoma (and for the Inter-High preliminaries), the Karasuno team heads to training camp. But even with their much-improved skills, Keishin must make a difficult choice for setter: Kageyama or Sugawara.

11.title: Decision
11.plot: With the practice match against Nekoma fully underway, Karasuno seems to be the team to beat-thanks to the fearsome power of the Hinata-Kageyama duo. But Nekoma devises a clever and unexpected plan to reverse their losing streak...

12.title: The Neko-Karasu Reunion
12.plot: In an epic showdown, Nekoma and Karasuno battle it out for the win. Though Karasuno suffer a close defeat, the resulting alliance the two teams form could lead them to victory at the Nationals.

13.title: Rival
13.plot: With the Inter-High finals fast approaching, the pairings of the preliminaries are announced, and the tension is mounting amongst the members of Karasuno volleyball club. ?Meanwhile, not to be left out, Yamaguchi is secretly working on mastering his unique jump float serve.

14.title: Formidable Opponents
14.plot: Karasuno's first match at the long-awaited Inter-High preliminaries is against Tokonami High School. With Karasuno leading 3-0, it's becoming clear that Karasuno is back in action-and better than ever!

15.title: Revival
15.plot: While Karasuno seems to be winning against Tokonami, the outclassed team are determined to turn things around. Meanwhile, on the other court, the Karasuno girls' team isn't doing nearly as well...

16.title: Winners and Losers
16.plot: With the second match underway-this time between Karasuno and Dateko-Dateko's best tactic is their killer serves. Karasuno do their best to counter their serves, until pulling out their last ace: their own version of Nekoma's tactic "Pipe".

17.title: The Iron Wall
17.plot: With Hinata and Kageyama's clever moves, Karasuno is now in the lead against Dateko. But with Aone blocking, Dateko seems poised to flip the script. Now it's up to ace Azumane to show his skills, and break through Detoko's "Iron Wall".

18.title: Guarding Your Back
18.plot: The match vs Date Tech continues - neither team managing to gain a decisive lead. As the match nears it's end, Asahi steps up as Karasuno's Ace. Will he finally gain his revenge?

19.title: Coaches
19.plot: It's a head-to-head match between Oikawa and Kageyama, and it shows no signs of letting up. It turns out their competitive duel goes way back. During the match, Aoba Johsai pulls a tactic that threatens to send Kageyama into "King Mode".

20.title: Oikawa Toru is not a Genius
20.plot: Switching things up, Sugawara replaces Kageyama, giving the first win to team Aoba Johsai. But during the second match, Karasuno takes the lead ... until Oikawa's predictions start coming true.

21.title: Senpai's True Abilities
21.plot: Sugawara takes the court and throws off Aoba Johsai's rhythm. This gives Kageyama a chance to watch his senior in action.

22.title: Evolution
22.plot: After a grueling loss of the first set to Aoba Johsai, Karasuno is as determined as ever to win the second set and hang onto their chance to make it in the preliminaries.

23.title: The Point That Changes the Momentum
23.plot: Karasuno plays the third set against Aoba Johsai, fighting to move on in the spring preliminaries

24.title: Removing the "Solitary King"
24.plot: Karasuna and Seijoh are 24-24 in the third set and the rallies are getting longer and longer.

25.title: The Third Day
25.plot: The third year students have a tough choice to make as the entire team recovers from the tournament.

26.title: OVA: The Arrival of Haiba Lev
26.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Let's Go to Tokyo!!
1.plot: Ever since losing the Inter-High Preliminaries, Team Karasuno have been training like crazy. When their teacher-in-charge Ittetsu Takeda announces that Karasuno will take part in Nekoma's training camp in Tokyo, Coach Ukai's wishes may just come true.

2.title: Direct Sunlight
2.plot: Hinata, Kageyama, Nishinoya, and the other the sophomores head to Tanaka's place to study, but their new tutor is less than helpful. But they may be in luck when Hitoka Yachi, their potential new manager, steps in to help.

3.title: Townsperson B
3.plot: Yachi has mixed feelings about joining the team, and she is less than thrilled to ask her mother for advice for fear that she might disapprove. That's when Hinata steps in to help her overcome her fears.

4.title: Center Ace
4.plot: After finishing their grueling exams, Hinata and Kageyama are finally ready to join the team at the training camp. Just in time, too, because without them, Karasuno has been losing ... and badly. Can the power duo help turn things around?

5.title: Greed
5.plot: When Hinata admits to wanting to eventually compete by himself, he and Kageyama get into an argument which ends in the silent treatment between them, putting the whole team on edge.

6.title: Tempo
6.plot: Kageyama seeks advice from Oikawa about Hinata's solo dreams, while Coach Ukai takes Hinata to meet Karasuno's former club coach ... also for advice about Hinata's solo dreams.

7.title: Moonrise
7.plot: At Shinzen High's campus, Karasuno arrives for training, where they are matched with Fukurōdani Academy, one of the top schools. Soon Hinata realises that Kageyama's tosses have changed, and now he has to work harder!

8.title: Illusionary Hero
8.plot: Tsukishima starts to question his own training regime, while Akiteru trains extra hard, eager to become a member of Karasuno, which now includes Hinata's idol, the "Little Giant."

9.title: VS. "Umbrella"
9.plot: In a practice match against Nekoma, Hinata recognises that Kageyama is now tossing the way he used to, so Kageyama decides to practice on his own to give Hinata the exact tosses he wants.

10.title: Cogs
10.plot: As the training camp winds to a close, all the hard work of Karasuno's members begins to come together.

11.title: Above
11.plot: With Bokuto still down in the dumps, Karasuno learns the hard way why Fukurōdani is still one of the best teams in Tokyo. Later, everyone enjoys a barbecue as training camp comes to an end-and talk of the spring tournament begins.

12.title: Let the Games Begin!
12.plot: It's the first match of the Spring Tournament. Karasuno faces an opponent who hasn't yet learned the games not over until it's over.

13.title: A Simple and Pure Strength
13.plot: In their first match for the preliminaries, Karasuno are stunned to be pitted against Kakugawa High School, whose secret weapon is a freshman named Hyakuzawa who is 2 meters tall! While Hyakuzawa is intimidating, Karasuno soon snap into action...

14.title: Still Growing
14.plot: With the qualifiers still two months out, Tsukishima's brother invites him to practice with his own team. Meanwhile, Kageyama goes undercover to spy on Aoba Jōsai, and later, Karasuno heads back to Kanto to work on their new tactics.

15.title: Place to Play
15.plot: Team Karasuno finally arrive at the pre-lims, where they are matched up against Johzenji High School, whose motto is simply "To Play". Are Karasuno ready for what the unpredictable Johzenji have in store for them?

16.title: Next
16.plot: Karasuno's next match up shows Hinata that he isn't the only one who idolizes "the Little Giant".

17.title: The Battle Without Will Power
17.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

18.title: The Losers
18.plot: As Aoba Jōsai's match against Dateko begins, team Karasuno struggle to stay in the game as their match against Wakutani continues ... with Sawamura still down for the count.

19.title: The Iron Wall Can Be Rebuilt Again and Again
19.plot: After Karasuno makes it to the semi-finals, their next opponent will be decided by a match between Aoba Jōsai and Dateko. But Aoba Jōsai have a secret weapon ... the gawky new guy, Koganegawa.

20.title: Wiping Out
20.plot: Karasuno begins their next match in the Preliminaries. If they want to fight Ushiwaka and Shiratorizawa then they're going to have to win. It isn't going to be easy.

21.title: The Destroyer
21.plot: Seijoh releases their Mad Dog and the rhythm of the game changes.

22.title: The Former Coward's Fight
22.plot: Yamaguchi is given a chance to redeem his former cowardice. Will his new found confidence prove justified?

23.title: Team
23.plot: As the final set of the semi-finals arrives, it's down to Karasuno and Seijoh. With both teams giving their all, Kyōtani's efforts are getting more and more out of hand during this last chance to win the third match.

24.title: The Absolute Limit Switch
24.plot: It's the last set and Karasuno is in the lead. Aoba Josai and Karasuno try their hardest to win, with the thought that the strongest six would be the ones who claim victory. But triumph is with Karasuno, as they win the match with Kageyama and Hinata's quick spike. Oikawa reflects that it is impossible for someone with no natural talent to beat any volleyball genius, no matter how much they train, strategize or who their teammates are, but he would continue on the path straight ahead of him with everything he's got.

25.title: Declaration of War
25.plot: Following their stunning victory, the Karasuno High School Volleyball Club finally move on to the Miyazaki Prefecture Qualifiers, where they will be facing the strongest school in the prefecture, Shiratorizawa Academy. Let the training begin!

26.title: OVA: VS Failing Grades
26.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: Hinata Shouyou, a short middle school student, gained a sudden love of volleyball after watching a national championship match on TV. Determined to become like the championship's star player, a short boy nicknamed "the small giant", Shouyou joined his school's volleyball club. Unfortunately, he was the only member and the club didn't have so much as a place to practice. He didn't let that deter him, however, and, upon finally acquiring 5 other players in his final year, was able to compete in an actual competition - only for his team to be unlucky enough to face the championship favorite and its star player, Kageyama Tobio, called "the king of the court", in the first round. Though Shouyou's team suffers a crushing defeat, he vows to become better and eventually surpass Kageyama. Now Shouyou is starting his first year in high school - the very one he had first watched in the national championships. He's going to join the volleyball team, practice constantly, and wipe the floor with Kageyama the next time they meet on the court. ...or at least that's what Shouyou had planned, until he discovers that he and Kageyama are now in the same school. The volleyball team definitely needs their skills, but only if they can stop bickering and learn to work together as teammates.
imdb.title: Haikyuu!!
plot: Hinata Shouyou, a short middle school student, gained a sudden love of volleyball after watching a national championship match on TV. Determined to become like the championship's star player, a short boy nicknamed "the small giant", Shouyou joined his school's volleyball club. Unfortunately, he was the only member and the club didn't have so much as a place to practice. He didn't let that deter him, however, and, upon finally acquiring 5 other players in his final year, was able to compete in an actual competition - only for his team to be unlucky enough to face the championship favorite and its star player, Kageyama Tobio, called "the king of the court", in the first round. Though Shouyou's team suffers a crushing defeat, he vows to become better and eventually surpass Kageyama. Now Shouyou is starting his first year in high school - the very one he had first watched in the national championships. He's going to join the volleyball team, practice constantly, and wipe the floor with Kageyama the next time they meet on the court. ...or at least that's what Shouyou had planned, until he discovers that he and Kageyama are now in the same school. The volleyball team definitely needs their skills, but only if they can stop bickering and learn to work together as teammates.::DevonHawk~
